summary:
*Crowley voice* 

Has anyone seen my Angel??? He's about uh..*holds hand up about a certain height* this tall, blond, loves...
body: *Crowley voice* Has anyone seen my Angel??? He's about uh..*holds hand up about a certain height* this tall, blond, loves books, rocks a vintage look??? No one???? I swear, you can't miss him. He has very blue eyes you can get lost in, has this lovely scent- I think it's a mixture of tea and books, very warm and cuddly, can glare daggers, enough of a bastard to be worth liking, and my hereditary enemy??? Oh! And he has this bright smile that can light up the day and-

summary: Hi. Anon here. I realized it too, but I was referring to the fact that they seem to go to great lenghts not to mention each...
question: Hi. Anon here. I realized it too, but I was referring to the fact that they seem to go to great lenghts not to mention each other anymore. Especially LC, she is still asked about and mentions MoS, like in an Australian article promoting DB, but it doesn't cite his famous costar, and on The Toll Road website's bio page of LC it name-drops her notable costars in every project to make her look important (as in TR bio page), except for her equally notable MoS costar on that two-handler show. Weird.
answer: I’ve understood and I agree it’s weird, but I don’t think it’s because she has bad memories/feelings about MS or because she wants to forget the time spent with him on the set. Maybe there is some reasons we simply don’t know, maybe some legal issues about MoS in general.

reblog.comment: I’ve understood and I agree it’s weird, but I don’t think it’s because she has bad memories/feelings about MS or because she wants to forget the time spent with him on the set. Maybe there is some reasons we simply don’t know, maybe some legal issues about MoS in general.

trail.content_raw: I’ve understood and I agree it’s weird, but I don’t think it’s because she has bad memories/feelings about MS or because she wants to forget the time spent with him on the set. Maybe there is some reasons we simply don’t know, maybe some legal issues about MoS in general.
trail.content: I’ve understood and I agree it’s weird, but I don’t think it’s because she has bad memories/feelings about MS or because she wants to forget the time spent with him on the set. Maybe there is some reasons we simply don’t know, maybe some legal issues about MoS in general.

summary:
PHOTOS: Go Behind The Scenes Of Good Omens With SFX

  

David Tennant and Michael Sheen are the cover stars of the June 2019...
caption:
PHOTOS: Go Behind The Scenes Of Good Omens With SFX

David Tennant and Michael Sheen are the cover stars of the June 2019 issue of SFX, which is out now. The magazine has Good Omens goodies galore with a behind the scenes on set exclusive look at the eagerly anticipated Amazon Prime series. David and Michael are interviewed about their characters, there’s lots of new photos and even a look at designing their costumes for the series.

Good Omens is a dark, comedic story set in modern day Britain on the brink of the Apocalypse. When a fussy angel, Aziraphale (Michael Sheen) and a suave demon, Crowley (David Tennant) get wind of the coming of the Antichrist, they join forces to prevent the loss of their comfortable lifestyle on Earth. Throw in a medley of unforgettable characters, some infernal riders, a host of angels, a legion of demons and a gang of unruly kids, and the end of the world will never be funnier! The show also stars Michael McKean, Jack Whitehall, Adria Arjona, Mireille Enos, Nick Offerman and Nina Sosanya. It will be released worldwide on Amazon Prime on 31st May.

The magazine is out in both print and digital editions now!

blog.name: tinsnip
blog.title: No, said Aziraphale, it's ineffable.
blog.description:
Hello, I'm tinsnip.

Feeling rather ineffable these days. Expect a great deal of Good Omens.

Other interests: Star Trek. (Primarily DS9 and Cardassians.)
Pratchett. Wodehouse.
Cats. The Doctors Whom. Science. Cute things. Life truths. Pixels. And spiders, sometimes, so keep that in mind.

I post fic on AO3. It's quite good - you should have a look.

My work with Vyc on a Kardasi conlang is here.

Cardassian meta is found mostly under cardassians or kardasi.

If you enjoy my fanfic, why not buy me a coffee?

summary: If we’re going by the idea that because Michael Sheen played Robbie Ross in ‘Wilde’, Aziraphale is Robbie Ross then I like the...
body:
If we’re going by the idea that because Michael Sheen played Robbie Ross in ‘Wilde’, Aziraphale is Robbie Ross then I like the idea that Michael Sheen’s other biopic roles follow that rule

By that logic, Aziraphale:

  • Was Oscar Wilde’s first lover (Robbie Ross, ‘Wilde’)
  • Was manager of Derby, Leeds, and Nottingham Forest football clubs among others (Brian Clough, ‘The Damned United’)
  • Interviewed Richard Nixon about the Watergate scandal (David Frost, ‘Frost/Nixon’)
  • Was prime minister of the United Kingdom (Tony Blair, ‘The Queen’)
  • Appeared in 26 ‘Carry On’ films (Kenneth Williams, ‘Fantabulosa!’)
  • Was the literal emperor of Rome (Nero, ‘Ancient Rome: The Rise and Fall of an Empire’)
  • Revolutionised the science fiction genre (H. G. Wells, ‘War with the World’)

reblog.comment:

  • Was prime minister of the United Kingdom (Tony Blair, ‘The Queen’)

trail.content_raw:
If we’re going by the idea that because Michael Sheen played Robbie Ross in ‘Wilde’, Aziraphale is Robbie Ross then I like the idea that Michael Sheen’s other biopic roles follow that rule

By that logic, Aziraphale:

  • Was Oscar Wilde’s first lover (Robbie Ross, ‘Wilde’)
  • Was manager of Derby, Leeds, and Nottingham Forest football clubs among others (Brian Clough, ‘The Damned United’)
  • Interviewed Richard Nixon about the Watergate scandal (David Frost, ‘Frost/Nixon’)
  • Was prime minister of the United Kingdom (Tony Blair, ‘The Queen’)
  • Appeared in 26 ‘Carry On’ films (Kenneth Williams, ‘Fantabulosa!’)
  • Was the literal emperor of Rome (Nero, ‘Ancient Rome: The Rise and Fall of an Empire’)
  • Revolutionised the science fiction genre (H. G. Wells, ‘War with the World’)
trail.content:
If we’re going by the idea that because Michael Sheen played Robbie Ross in ‘Wilde’, Aziraphale is Robbie Ross then I like the idea that Michael Sheen’s other biopic roles follow that rule

By that logic, Aziraphale:

  • Was Oscar Wilde’s first lover (Robbie Ross, ‘Wilde’)
  • Was manager of Derby, Leeds, and Nottingham Forest football clubs among others (Brian Clough, ‘The Damned United’)
  • Interviewed Richard Nixon about the Watergate scandal (David Frost, ‘Frost/Nixon’)
